channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Attempting to predict the economy in 2026
item.description: Economists may have a pretty dismal record with predictions. But we're still interested in what they see in their non-existent crystal balls.

item.title: Hungarian filmmaker Béla Tarr — known for bleak, existential movies — has died
item.description: Tarr's films were long, dark, and often abstract explorations of everyday life and politics.

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene's puzzling political transformation, explained
item.description: Once a fierce advocate for Trump and his MAGA base, Greene has broken with the president and resigned from Congress. New Yorker writer Charles Bethea ...

item.title: Lawmakers split over Maduro's seizure. And, CDC cuts childhood vaccine schedule
item.description: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife pleaded not guilty in New York yesterday. And, the CDC scales back routine childhood vaccine reco...

item.title: Edith Renfrow Smith, pioneer and witness to history, dies at 111
item.description: Last year, for Black History Month, NPR's Scott Simon spoke with Edith Renfrow Smith of Chicago, who has died at 111 years old.

item.title: 3 reasons mortgage rates could fall again soon
item.description: Mortgage rates noticeably declined in 2025. Here's what needs to happen for them to fall again in early 2026.

item.title: How do you qualify for credit card debt consolidation?
item.description: There are a couple of debt consolidation options to consider, each with its own set of requirements for borrowers.

item.title: Fifth anniversary of the Jan. 6 attack brings fresh division to the Capitol
US may intercept and seize oil tanker heading for Europe, reports say
item.description: US officials have a warrant to seize the Russian-flagged ship accused of breaking sanctions.

item.title: Alaska Airlines pilot who safely landed plane after panel blew out says Boeing unfairly blamed him
Congress facing another government shutdown deadline; Senate to vote on war powers resolution
item.description: The Senate is expected to vote this week on a war powers resolution that would block the U.S. from further military action against Venezuela without c...

item.title: Uvalde schools officer did nothing until it was too late during shooting, prosecutor says
item.description: A Texas prosecutor says a school police officer made no attempt to distract or stop the gunman during the school shooting in Uvalde in 2022.

item.title: Six dead and hundreds of flights cancelled as snow causes chaos across Europe
item.description: Hundreds of flights have been cancelled in Amsterdam and Paris, with thousands of people stranded.

item.title: BBC looks into the relationship between Cuba and Venezuela
item.description: The BBC's Cuba correspondent, Will Grant, explains what's the nature of the relationship between Venezuela and Cuba.

item.title: US Congressman Doug LaMalfa dies unexpectedly at 65
item.description: The death of LaMalfa, a Trump ally, shaves the Republican majority in the US House of Representatives to just a few seats.

item.title: Venezuela's future in balance after Trump officials brief lawmakers; Maduro in jail
item.description: Ex-Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro spent the night in jail after he appeared in a U.S. courtroom — as questions linger about President Trump's pla...

item.title: The painful questions for Nato and the EU as Trump threatens Greenland
item.description: Were Trump to make good on his ambition to bring Greenland under US control, would it mark not just an existential threat to Nato but also a major cri...

item.title: A timeline of the Karen Read case
item.description: A look at the timeline of events in Karen Read's high-profile Massachusetts murder trial and retrial. Read was acquitted of killing her boyfriend, Bos...
